course.subject: MATH
course.name: Statistical Learning Models for Text and Graph Data
course.description: This course will introduce a number of important statistical methods and modeling principles for analyzing large-scale data sets, with a focus on complex data structures such as text and graph data. Topics covered include sequential models, structure prediction models, deep learning attention models, reinforcement learning models, etc., as well as open research problems in this area.

reviews.author: Aaron W
reviews.comment_content:
Being the graduate level version of MATH4824B/4901K, there is a lot less hand-holding in this course and it assumes that you are comfortable with probability and basic machine learning. Content wise, the course gives an overview of a lot of different branches/areas of machine learning in NLP, including a lot of very recent topics, such as BERT and transformers. The topics included:
Sequence Modeling
Featurized Sequence Modeling
Neural Sequence Modeling
SGD Optimization
Word Embedding
Topic Models
Graph Models
Sequence Tagging
Constraint Models
Knowledge Graphs
reviews.comment_teaching: Yangqiu was quite clear in the lectures, but he does tend to skip over a lot of the math involved so it can be a bit confusing at times. Regardless, he was able to get across the important points, giving you a good idea of the recent developments in the field.

reviews.comment_workload:
There was basically zero workload except for the project/survey.

There were 4 reading notes, which basically involved you reading choosing a paper from conferences this year and writing a few comments to summarise it (and a question you would ask the authors).

The course is co-listed with COMP5222, and the only difference is that students under the MATH code can choose to do a survey instead of the project. The survey had to be done individually, but  the project could be done individually or in groups of 2. I opted for the survey, which meant I just had to read a bunch of papers and write a paper summarising the techniques and their findings.
